children.name: to cheat in an examination or game
cheat b2
children.definition: cheat/tʃiːt/  to use dishonest methods in order to pass an examination or win a game:
examples: gian lận
▪ studies indicate about 20 to 30 percent of college students cheat.cheat at
▪ jenny always cheats at cards.
cheating[uncountable noun] when someone cheats in an examination or game::
gian giận
▪ their teacher suspected them of cheating when they both missed the same question on the test.

children.name: copy
children.definition: /ˈkɒpiǁˈkɑː-/  to cheat in an examination, schoolwork etc by copying someone’s work:
examples: sao chép
▪ if i see anyone copying i’ll send you straight to the principal’s office.
copy off
sao chép hết
▪ the only way i made it through high school was by copying off my best friend.
copy something from something
sao chép cái gì từ cái gì
▪ she was expelled for handing in an essay that she had copied directly from a newspaper article.

children.name: test a1
children.definition: test a set ofspokenorwrittenquestions or practical activities, which are intended to find out how much sb knows about a subject or skill: bài kiểm tra
examples: i have a chemistry test tomorrow.
test on
we have a test on irregular verbs tomorrow.
did you get a good mark in the test ?
take a test(alsodo/sit a testbritish english)all candidates have to take a test.
pass a test(= succeed in it )she passed her driving test first time.
fail a test(alsoflunk a testamerican english informal)he failed the test and had to take it again.
do well/badly in a testbritish english,do well/badly on a testamerican english i didn’t do very well in the first part of the test.
give sb a testthe students were given a reading test.
grade a test(alsomark a testbritish english)i spent the day marking tests.
a biology/history etc teston monday we had a french test.
a spelling/reading/listening testi didn’t do very well in the listening test.
a driving/ driver’s testa driving test can be a nerve-racking experience.
a written testselection was based on written tests in english and mathematics.
a multiple choice test(= in which each question has a list of answers to choose from )there is some debate about whether multiple-choice tests are a good way of assessing student’s knowledge.
an aptitude test(= a test that measures your natural abilities )
an oral testthe oral test will consist of a conversation of about 10 minutes in german.
a test paperthe teacher began handing out the test papers.
a test result/scorethe test results are out on friday.
a test questionsome of the test questions were really difficult.
common errors
►do not say 'make a test'. saytake a testordo a test.

children.name: exam a2
children.definition: exam/ examinationformal animportanttest that you do at theend of acourseof study or at the end of the school year: bài thi
examples: students are not allowed to talk during the examination.
he’s upstairs, revising for an exam.
in an examuk /on an examus trong bài thi
how did you do in your exams?
a chemistry/french etc exami knew i wouldn’t pass the german exam.
a written examthere is a written exam at the end of the course.
an oral exam[oraluk](= in which you answer questions by speaking )i have my french oral exams next week.
a mock examuk/mocksuk(= one that you do to practise for the real exams) bài thi thử
he did well in the mock exams.
a practical exam[practicaluk] (= in which you have to make or do things )there’s a practical exam as well as a written one.
a final exam(= at the end of a course )the students take their final exams in june.
the end of year/term exambre: i knew i had to do well in the end of year exams.
high school examsgreg got good grades in all of his high school exams.
an entrance exam(= in order to enter a school or university )jane passed the entrance exam but decided not to go.
a professional exam(= to qualify in a profession, for example to be an accountant )once you’ve passed your professional exams, you can start to build up your experience.
the bar exam(= in order to become a lawyer )he is studying for the bar exam.
board examsamerican english(= in order to become a nurse or doctor )he failed his board exams in psychiatry.
exam resultsthe school achieves consistently good exam results.
an exam paperi’ve still got dozens of exam papers to mark.
an exam questionread the exam questions carefully before writing your answers.
exam revisionbre: i have to do my exam revision this weekend.
exam practiceschools say they have to spend too much time doing exam practice.
an exam essay/script(= that someone has written during an exam )i’ve brought in some old exam scripts for us to look at.
exam technique(= good ways to succeed in exams )mr frasier gave us some useful tips on exam technique.
exam markspupils were divided into classes with a similar range of ability, based on their previous exam marks.
take/do an exam(alsosit an exambritish english)we have to take exams at the end of each year.
pass an exam(= succeed in it )did you pass your final exam?
fail an examif you fail the exam, you can retake it.
do well/badly in an exambritish english,do well/badly on an examameː maria always did well in her exams at school.
study for an exam(alsorevise for an exambritish english)she has to study for her exams.
sail though an exam(= pass it easily )don’t worry - i'm sure you’ll sail through all your exams.
scrape through an exam(= only just pass it )he managed to scrape through the exam and stay on the course.
flunk an examamerican english informal(= fail it )i flunked all my first year exams.
cheat in an exambritish english,cheat on an examame: she was caught cheating in the exam.
retake an exam(alsoresit an exambritish english) (= take it again because you did not do well the first time )if you don’t do well, you’ll have to resit the exam in january.
common errors
►do not say 'make an exam'. saytake an examordo an exam.

children.name: quiz a2
children.definition: quiz us aquicktest that a teacher gives to a class, usually to check that students are learning the things they should be learning: bài kiểm tra nhanh
examples: we have a history quiz every monday.
pop quiza quiz that is not expected by the students kiểm tra bất ngờ
he likes giving pop quizzes, to see if the kids are remembering anything.

children.name: finals x
children.definition: finals uk the last exams that you take at the end of a uk university course: đợt thi cuối cùng
examples: during my finals i was revising till 3 o'clock in the morning most days.

children.name: final x
children.definition: final us an important test that you take at the end of a particular class in high school or college : bài kiểm tra cuối kì
examples: the english final was pretty hard.
this class will require two papers, a midterm, and a final.

children.name: midterm x
children.definition: midterm us an important test that you take in the middle of a term, covering what you have learned in a particular class in high school or college: bài kiểm tra giữa kì
examples: he did badly in the midterm.

children.name: to do a test or exam
take b1
children.definition: take làm
examples: anna will be taking her music exam in the summer.
most young people take the sat exams in their last year of high school.
i took my driving test when i was 18.

children.name: have
children.definition: / have got if you have an examtomorrow, next week etc,you are going to do it then:có
examples: we have a quiz every week on what we’ve been reading.
i have a written exam in the morning and an interview in the afternoon.
lucy’s got her driving test next week.

children.name: do
children.definition: uk do is more informal that take, and is used especially in conversation: làm
examples: i’d better go home -- i’ve got to do an exam in the morning.
the kids are doing a test this morning.

children.name: sit b2
children.definition: sit uk to do a written school or college exam: làm
examples: i sat my final exams last year.
after i've sat my exams, i'm going on holiday.

children.name: pass a2
children.definition: pass/  to reach a high enough standard to succeed in an examination or test:đậu
examples: ‘i’m taking my driving test today.’ ‘do you think you’ll pass?’
new recruits have to pass a physical fitness test.
pass with flying coloursbritish /colorsamerican pass a test or examination with very high marks đậu với số điểm cao
she was so nervous about her examination results, but in fact she passed with flying colours.

children.name: scrape through x
children.definition: scrape through especially uk,informalto only just pass an examination, by getting only a few marks more than arenecessary: vượt qua
examples: daniel scraped through the entrance exam.
i scraped through my exams with marks just good enough to keep my place in the school of pharmacy.

children.name: qualify b2
children.definition: qualify especially uk to pass all the examinations that you need in order to becomeadoctor, lawyer, engineer etc: đủ trình độ, đạt trình độ
examples: after qualifying, she joined the natwest bank as a corporate advisor.
qualify as
she wanted to improve her english so she could qualify as a translator.

children.name: get through b2
children.definition: get through to pass a difficult test or examination: vượt qua
examples: the entrance exam is very difficult and only a small minority of candidates get through.
get through sth
she got through her exams without too much trouble.

children.name: sail through x
children.definition: sail/ breeze through informal to pass a test or examination very easily:
examples: ‘how’d his exams go?’ "he breezed through - no trouble at all.
sail/breeze through sth
she sailed through her driving test the first time.

children.name: be given a pass b2
children.definition: be given a pass đậu
examples: my teacher told me she passed me only because she knew i’d had a really hard year.
i didn’t think the candidate deserved to be given a pass but the other examiners disagreed.
pass[ c ] b2 uk a successful result in an examination
jonathon hill achieved grade a passes at a-level.

children.name: to give students a test or exam
give sb a test a1
children.definition: give sb a test to make sb do a test: đưa ra bài thi
examples: schools are required to give students national standardized tests.
give sb a test on
the french teacher gave us a test on irregular verbs, and i got 100%.

children.name: test b1
children.definition: test  to ask sbwrittenorspokenquestions to find out what they know about a subject:kiểm tra
examples: new students are tested in math and reading, and placed in the appropriate class.
test sb on sth
tomorrow you’ll be tested on the main events of the civil war.

children.name: set sb an exam a2
children.definition: set sb an exam uk to choose the questions that are in a test or exam: ra đề
examples: next lesson i’m setting you all a test to see how much you’ve learned.
whoever set the exam didn’t seem to know the material very well.

children.name: set sb a test a1
children.definition: set sb a test uk to choose the questions that are in a test or exam: ra đề
examples: next lesson i’m setting you all a test to see how much you’ve learned.
whoever set the exam didn’t seem to know the material very well.

children.name: examine c2
children.definition: examineformalto ask sb questions in an exam in order to find out what they know about a particular subject:kiểm tra
examples: to save time, students will be examined in groups of three.
examine sb on sth
students will be examined on all aspects of russian literature and history.
we were examinedoneuropean history.
ukyou'll be examinedinthree main areas; speaking, listening and reading comprehension.

children.name: fail a2
children.definition: fail to not succeed in an examination or test:trượt
examples: jonathan failed his law exams at the end of the year.
if i fail my driving test again, i’m going to give up.
‘how did you do in accountancy?’ ‘i failed’
many of the boys in the program had been failing at school.
i passed in history but failedinchemistry.
fail by 2 marks/ 5% etc
we expected her to pass easily, but she failed by 15 marks.

children.name: flunk x
children.definition: flunk especially us,informalto fail an examination or test:trượt
examples: he thought he was going to flunk chemistry, but he got a d.
i flunked, and had to do the test again.
he was cutting school and flunking classes.
she flunked the state bar exam four times before she finally passed.
flunk outfail all your classes, so that you have to leave school bị đuổi học
brant flunked out of college his first year.
you either pass and get your degree or flunk out.
flunk out of college/school etc
it was extremely humiliating to flunk out of law school like that.

children.name: bomb x
children.definition: bomb us informal to fail very badly:rớt thê thảm
examples: i bombed the english test yesterday.
i bombed on the quiz he gave us.
‘how’d it go?’ ‘i bombed on the written section, but i think i did okay on the multiple choice part.’

children.name: to do a test or exam again
retake x
children.definition: retake to do a test or exam again because you have previously failed it: làm cái gì lại lần nữa
examples: she wants to retake her french a-level exam.
ralph retook his driver’s test in june.
retake[c] uk:
can you sit a retake?

children.name: resit x
children.definition: resit uk to do a written school or college exam again because you have previously failed it: thi lại
examples: it only makes sense to resit an exam if you strongly believe you will do better.
resit[c] thi lại
is a resit possible?

children.name: take again b1
children.definition: take sth again to do a test or exam again because you have previously failed it: làm cái gì lại lần nữa
examples: if you fail the test, you can always take it again

children.name: examiner b1
children.definition: examiner uk sb who judges exams or tests: người chấm thi
examples: the examiner told him to relax and then asked him to turn on the engine.
students who, in the opinion of the examiners, do not reach the required standard must take the exam again.

children.name: candidate b1
children.definition: candidate uk sb who does an exam: thí sinh
examples: candidates should be at their desks 5 minutes before the start of the examination.
candidates must write their names on the top page of the exam paper.

children.name: exercise a2
children.definition: exercise a set of questions in a book that test a student’s knowledge or skill : bài tập
examples: do exercises 3 and 4 on page 51 for homework.
the exercises in chapter 3 are helpful for students learning the future tense.
a book of guitar exercises to improve finger flexibility
the book has exercises at the end of every chapter.

children.name: paper a2
children.definition: paper uk a set of printed questions used as an examination in a particular subject, or the answers people write : đề thi/ bài làm
examples: the geography paper is not till next week.
the history paper was really difficult.
the papers are marked by the other teachers.
candidates must answer two questions from each paper.

children.name: a system of using exams and tests
assessment b2
children.definition: assessment especially uk a method used to find out how good a student is at a particular subject, for example by giving them written work, tests, or exams: cáchđánh giá (kết quả học tập)
examples: assessment is by means of a written exam at the end of the course.
continuous assessmentassessment throughout a student’s course of study, instead of only at the end đánh giá liên tục
most schools nowadays prefer to use continuous assessment, because it gives a fairer picture of how the student has done during the whole year.

children.name: testing x
children.definition: testing the system of using exams and tests to find out how good sb is at a particular subject:kiểm tra, đánh giá
examples: the government plans to introduce compulsory testing in junior schools from the age of 7.
i believe that some sort of testing is always necessary in order to motivate students.

children.name: to make sb pass a test
pass a2
children.definition: pass cho đậu
examples: my teacher told me she passed me only because she knew i’d had a really hard year.

children.name: qualify b2
children.definition: qualify if sth qualifies you to do sth, you have the necessary skills, knowledge, ability etc to do it
examples: qualify sb for sth
fluency in three languages qualifies her for work in the european parliament.
qualify sb to do sth
the certificate qualifies you to work as a dental assistant.
this course qualifies youtoteach in any secondary school.

children.name: get through b2
children.definition: get sb through sth to pass a difficult test or examination: vượt qua
examples: reading that book at the last minute was the only thing that got me through the history exam.

children.name: to make sb fail a test
fail a2
children.definition: fail to judge that someone has been unsuccessful in a test or examination : đánh trượt
examples: the examiners failed him because he hadn't answered enough questions.
